intro: Neuontobotrys robustus, commonly known as the robust spurge, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and often showy inflorescences. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically green and slightly hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Neuontobotrys robustus is often found in dry, open habitats and can thrive in poor soils.
